item.title: Jason Furman on gas tax incidence, policy economics, and other matters
item.description:
Jason Furman on Twitter

‚ÄúStrange @paulkrugman piece that starts by demolishing an argument on the gas tax that no one has actually made (that 0% of the benefit goes to consumers) and goes on to make an assertion that is likely wrong (that 100% of the benefit goes to consumers). https://t.co/h3UPIuDaWu‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/jasonfurman/status/1496232259371868165

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: Jeremy Horpedahl üçû on Twitter
item.description:
Jeremy Horpedahl üçû on Twitter

URL: https://twitter.com/jmhorp/status/1496501581562404868

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: Jason Furman on Twitter
item.description:
Jason Furman on Twitter

‚Äú@paulkrugman And you really think the gasoline supply curve is vertical in the summer but horizontal in March? And wouldn‚Äôt the gas tax holiday go through summer?‚Äù
